TcpKnnH 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Create and Organize Directory Structure

    directories.Rd

    This function generates and organizes the directory structure needed for storing results, datasets, partitions, reports, and other relevant files in a machine learning workflow.

    directories(parameters)

    Arguments

    parameters

    A list containing configuration parameters, including:

    • Folder.ResultsThe root directory for storing results.

    • FolderRootThe main root directory.

    • ValidationThe validation method used (e.g., "Silhouette", "Macro-F1", "Micro-F1", "Hamming-Loss").

    • ClassifierThe name of the classifier being used.

    • SimilarityThe similarity measure used in evaluation.

    Value

    A list containing paths to the created directories:

    folderResults

    Main results directory.

    folderUtils

    Directory for utility files.

    folderDatasets

    Directory for dataset storage.

    folderLabelSpace

    Subdirectory for label space data.

    folderNamesLabels

    Subdirectory for label names.

    folderCV

    Cross-validation directory.

    folderCVTR

    Training data directory within cross-validation.

    folderCVTS

    Test data directory within cross-validation.

    folderCVVL

    Validation data directory within cross-validation.

    folderPartitions

    Directory for data partitions.

    folderCommunities

    Directory for community detection results.

    Python

    Directory for Python scripts.

    folderValidation

    Directory for validation results.

    folderTest

    Directory for test results.

    folderRootReports

    Root directory for reports.

    folderReports

    Directory for specific reports.

    folderRepSim

    Directory for similarity-based reports.

    folderRepClassifier

    Directory for classifier-specific reports.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
params <- list(Folder.Results = "results", FolderRoot = "root",
               Validation = "Silhouette", Classifier = "SVM", Similarity = "Cosine")
dirs <- directories(params)
print(dirs$folderResults)
} # }
